page.title: 02RAILWAY SERVICES, RUGELEY
page.content: Rugeley Trent Valley Station is about one mile out of town halfway to Colton village. The main traffic is Inter- City passenger services connecting London with Scotland and the North West. These trains do not stop at Rugeley. The main freight is coal from Leicestershire and Cannock to Rugeley power stations. The remainder is mixed freight and Freightliner services. Local passenger trains cater for commuters to Stafford and stations to Rugby. Four local trains each way stop at Rugeley per day. The local passenger services are used by few people because it is cheaper in most cases to go by bus and the station is so far out of town. The Trent Valley line through Rugeley was electrified under the 1950/60 West Coast Mainline electrification programme.
